moves.1. e4:
This is one of the Best games i have ever played. From a losing position i recovered and was able to draw this match

1. Normal King e4 opening which gives open space to both queen and bishop

I request everybody to post their comments and give their feedback please
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3: I attacked his pawn with my horse
moves.2... d6: He opened his Knight and his main idea was to attack my horse..Bg4
moves.4... Qe7: I dont know why he kept queen in that position
moves.5. Nc3 c6 6. a3 Qf6 7. d3 Be7 8. Be3: My whole idea was to control the centre of the board
moves.9... Qxe6 10. d4 Na6 11. d5 Qg6 12. O-O: he tried to attack my king with his queen, pawn and open rook...but i had other ideas
moves.15. dxc6 bxc6 16. Qxd6: The queen out with a bang
moves.16... Ne7 17. Qxe5: its time for some queen play
moves.19. Qc4 g4: Now i am in the back foot. danger with the pawn
moves.20. Nh2 gxh3: Things who have gone worse if i had consumed the pawn
moves.26. f3 Qxg3+ 27. Qg2: I had to go for exchange to save the game
atlast some relief, but still he had 1 pawn extra
My whole idea was to repel the horse attack with my own horse
moves.35... Ne6 36. Kg3 Rh8 37. Rh1 g5 38. f4: Now only with rook remaining..still he had 1 pawn extra
moves.51... Ra2 52. Rd2 Kxe4: Now we are both with same points
moves.53. Rd7 Ra4 54. Rc7 Kd5 55. c3 a6 56. Rd: traces of a draw...but still he had 1 pawn extra
The opponent was severally trying to push the pawn
moves.66. Rf3+ Ke2 67. Kf4 Rf1 68. Rxf1 Kxf1: oh now only with a pawn left and i had a clear passage to remove it
moves.69. Ke3 a4 70. Kd2 a3 71. Kc2 a2 72. Kb2: At last the game ended in a draw
